qas.question: How many laws are there in the official Laws of the Game?
Who maintains the Laws of the Game?
Broad terms in the laws allow for what?
Who publishes the Laws of the Game?
How many laws are excluded from the official Laws of the Game?
Who avoids the Laws of the Game?
What do broad terms in the laws help eliminate?
Who doesn't read the Laws of the Game?
How many people follow the official Laws of the Game?

context: There are <a0_0><b4_0><b8_0>17<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> laws in the official Laws of the Game, each containing a collection of stipulation and guidelines. The same laws are designed to apply to all levels of football, although certain modifications for groups such as juniors, seniors, women and people with physical disabilities are permitted. The laws are often framed in broad terms, which allow <a2_0><b6_0>flexibility<b6_0/><a2_0/> in their application depending on the nature of the game. The Laws of the Game are published by <a3_0><b7_0>FIFA<b7_0/><a3_0/>, but are maintained by the <a1_0><b5_0>International Football Association Board (IFAB)<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In addition to the seventeen laws, numerous IFAB decisions and other directives contribute to the regulation of football.
